docs.snippet: LEAD: WESTCHESTER has become the first county in the state to join with Federal agencies and a local private hospital in forming a Disaster Medical Assistance Team. This team - volunteer doctors, nurses, technical staff and other health profession...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: WESTCHESTER has become the first county in the state to join with Federal agencies and a local private hospital in forming a Disaster Medical Assistance Team. This team - volunteer doctors, nurses, technical staff and other health professionals - will be available to assist in rescue efforts in the county or anywhere in the United

headline.main: A New Team Is Ready for Disasters

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 17-- The United Nations agency that is supposed to direct disaster relief has achieved little, labors under a top-heavy bureaucracy and uses its sophisticated computers to entertain visitors, according to a watchdog unit...
docs.abstract: UN inspectors criticize UN Disaster Relief Coordinator (UNDRO) Geneva, which was to coordinate activities of relief agencies and refugee organizations during major disasters; contend agency achieves little, labors under top-heavy bureaucracy and uses its sophisticated computers to entertain visitors; says UNDRO's staff has been multiplied 8-fold and its budget increased 11-fold in 8 1/2 years; UNDRO is headed by Faruk N Berkol, Turkish diplomat (M)

byline.original: By BERNARD D. NOSSITER Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 17-- The United Nations agency that is supposed to direct disaster relief has achieved little, labors under a top-heavy bureaucracy and uses its sophisticated computers to entertain visitors, according to a watchdog unit of the world organization.

headline.main: U.N.Inspectors Criticize Agency Created to Handle Disaster Relief; Role in Relieving Suffering Radios Put in Storage Library Set Up in 1976

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (AP)--A private study group says that new international protection is needed for victims of natural disasters because relief aid is frequently withheld for political reasons....
docs.abstract: UN Assn study indicates that in 1/3 of 89 natural disasters between '72 and '76 there were allegations of pol interference blocking relief efforts; says allegations, while difficult to prove, are indicative of recurring, serious problems; says most frequent problem is refusal of govts to acknowledge slowly developing disasters (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (AP)--A private study group says that new international protection is needed for victims of natural disasters because relief aid is frequently withheld for political reasons.

headline.main: STUDY SAYS NATIONS TEND TO HAMPER DISASTER AID

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 27 -- The League of Red Cross Societies began talks today seeking a solid partnership with the United Nations in efforts to aid countries before and after disasters....

byline.original: By KATHLEEN TELTSCHSpecial to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 27 -- The League of Red Cross Societies began talks today seeking a solid partnership with the United Nations in efforts to aid countries before and after disasters.

headline.main: RED CROSS SEEKS CLOSER TIE TO U.N.; Hopes to Combine Efforts on Aid in Disasters

docs.snippet: The United States is planning to establish a nationwide. Natural Disaster Warning System that may well cut in half the death toll and reduce substantially the annual economic losses caused by nature's violence....
docs.abstract: Plan for nationwide Natural Disaster Warning System, proposed by Sec Connor, announced by White House; details; Asst Sec Holloman comments
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States is planning to establish a nationwide. Natural Disaster Warning System that may well cut in half the death toll and reduce substantially the annual economic losses caused by nature's violence.

headline.main: U.S. Plans a System To Speed Warnings Of Natural Disaster

docs.snippet: GARDEN CITY, L.I., Aug. 14 --The National Search and Rescue Plan, designed to cope with any type of disaster requiring large-scale assistance, was demonstrated here today at Mitchel Air Force Base....
docs.abstract: Natl Search and Rescue Plan developed by Air Coordinating Com demonstrated, USAF Mitchel Base; unifies rescue work of civilian and mil agencies in all types of disasters; used for 129 missions since June 1

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: GARDEN CITY, L.I., Aug. 14 --The National Search and Rescue Plan, designed to cope with any type of disaster requiring large-scale assistance, was demonstrated here today at Mitchel Air Force Base.

headline.main: NEW RESCUE PLAN IS DEMONSTRATED; AirForce, Executive Agent for All Forces in 15 States, Stages Disaster Test 129 Missions Since June 1

docs.snippet: A CERTAIN physician, whom we shall call Dr. Jones, worked recently in the medical depart  ment of a life insurance company in a town in New England. Dr. Jones became much alarmed over the future atom bombing of his town....
docs.abstract: E C Berkeley article, We Are Safer Than We Think; illus
docs.lead_paragraph: A CERTAIN physician, whom we shall call Dr. Jones, worked recently in the medical depart ment of a life insurance company in a town in New England. Dr. Jones became much alarmed over the future atom bombing of his town.

headline.main: We Are Safer Than We Think; Our chances to survive man-made and natural catastrophes are, on the record, very good.
